channel.title: BBC Sport - Sport
channel.description: The latest stories from the Sport section of the BBC Sport web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Farah runs half of London Marathon
item.description: "Next year I'll do the full race," he says.

item.title: Vettel dominates to take Bahrain win
item.description: Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel takes his second win in four races this year as he dominates the Bahrain Grand Prix.

item.title: Charge after player punched on pitch
Tottenham 3-1 Man City
item.description: Tottenham's stunning comeback against Manchester City leaves Manchester United three points away from the Premier League title.

item.title: Djokovic beats Nadal in final
item.description: Novak Djokovic beats Rafael Nadal to win his first Monte Carlo Masters title and end the Spaniard's unbeaten run.

item.title: Jeptoo & Kebede take marathon wins
item.description: Priscah Jeptoo capitalises on Tiki Gelana's fall to win the London Marathon, with Tsegaye Kebede winning the men's race.

item.title: Ireland's Martin wins oldest classic
item.description: Ireland's Daniel Martin secures his first classic win in the Liege-Bastogne-Liege on Sunday.

item.title: GB's Oldham clinches high bar silver
item.description: Sam Oldham completes Great Britain's five-medal haul at the European Gymnastic Championships with a silver.

item.title: Russian tycoon top of rich list
item.description: Arsenal FC shareholder Alisher Usmanov tops the annual Sunday Times list of the wealthiest people in Britain and Ireland with a Â£13.3bn fortune.

item.title: Fury moves closer to world title
item.description: Tyson Fury moves closer to a world heavyweight title fight after knocking out American Steve Cunningham in New York.

item.title: Cleverly targets Hopkins unification
item.description: WBO champion Nathan Cleverly says he wants to test his credentials as an "elite level boxer" against Bernard Hopkins.

item.title: Daley eases into final on return
item.description: British Olympic bronze medallist Tom Daley qualifies for Sunday night's World Series platform final in Edinburgh

item.title: Arsenal Ladies exit Champions League
item.description: Arsenal are out of the Women's Champions League after a 4-1 aggregate defeat in their semi-final against Wolfsburg.

item.title: Brownlee eases to San Diego win
item.description: Olympic champion Alistair Brownlee wins by 20 seconds in San Diego in his first triathlon of the 2013 World Series.

item.title: Shooter Wilson wins World Cup gold
item.description: London 2012 gold medallist Peter Wilson wins shooting gold in the United Arab Emirates on his competitive return.

item.title: In pictures: London Marathon
item.description: Thousands of runners are taking part in Sunday's London Marathon, amid tightened security following the Boston Marathon bombings.

item.title: Sir Chris Hoy's career in pictures
item.description: A look back at Sir Chris Hoy's career, with the six-time Olympic champion expected to announce his retirement from the sport.

item.title: VIDEO: Moto3 Grand Prix - USA
item.description: Watch live coverage of MotoGP, Moto2 and Moto3 races from the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, Texas.

item.title: VIDEO: Bahrain Grand Prix highlights
item.description: Watch BBC One highlights of the Bahrain Grand Prix from the Bahrain International Circuit.

item.title: VIDEO: Ethiopia's Kebede wins men's marathon
item.description: Ethiopian Tsegaye Kebede storms through late on to win the London Marathon for a second time.

item.title: VIDEO: Highlights - Vettel powers to Bahrain win
item.description: Watch race highlights as Red Bull's Sebastian Vettel powers to a dominant victory in the Bahrain Grand Prix.

item.title: VIDEO: Marathon runner hit by wheelchair
item.description: Olympic marathon champion Tiki Gelana collides with wheelchair athlete Josh Cassidy during the 2013 London Marathon.

item.title: VIDEO: Kenya's Jeptoo wins women's marathon
item.description: Kenya's Priscah Jeptoo says she is very happy with her "tough" 2013 London Marathon win in two hours, 20 minutes and 13 seconds.

item.title: VIDEO: Marquez grabs maiden pole in Texas
item.description: Spain's Marc Marquez becomes the youngest rider to earn a MotoGP pole position after setting the fastest time ahead of Sunday's Grand Prix of the Americas.

item.title: VIDEO: QPR dream in tatters - Redknapp
item.description: QPR boss Harry Redknapp admits his team's dream of Premier League survival "looks to be in tatters" after a 2-0 defeat at home to fellow strugglers Stoke.

item.title: VIDEO: Wenger on Arsenal's 'sensational' run
item.description: Arsene Wenger says Arsenal's recent run of form has been "sensational" after the Gunners boosted their hopes of a Premier League top four finish with a 1-0 win at Fulham.

item.title: VIDEO: Fulham played like lions - Jol
item.description: Martin Jol says his Fulham side "played like lions" and "heroes," after competing for the most part with 10 men during their 1-0 home defeat to Arsenal.

item.title: VIDEO: Pardew admits Newcastle aren't safe
item.description: Newcastle manager Alan Pardew says his side have "got to keep working" if they are to avoid relegation following their 1-1 draw against West Brom.

item.title: VIDEO: Yorston screamer boosts Bristol
item.description: Bristol Academy's Corinne Yorston scores a spectacular brace as they beat Everton 4-3 in the Women's Super League.

item.title: VIDEO: Stanford sprints to dramatic second
item.description: American Gwen Jorgensen wins the second women's race of the World Triathlon Series, while Britain's Non Stanford secures second with a sprint finish.

item.title: VIDEO: Snooker - Higgins v Davis
item.description: Live coverage of table one at the World Snooker Championship from the Crucible in Sheffield.

item.title: VIDEO: Neil Lennon addresses Celtic fans
item.description: Celtic manager Neil Lennon speaks to fans after clinching the Scottish Premier League title and thanks them for their support.

item.title: VIDEO: Brownlee wins San Diego race in style
item.description: Alistair Brownlee dominated in his 2013 World Triathlon Series debut to win the second race of the season in San Diego, United States.

item.title: VIDEO: Marathon support incredible - Farah
item.description: Double Olympic gold medallist Mo Farah says the support he received from spectators while running half of the London Marathon was "unbelievable".

item.title: VIDEO: Weir beaten in thrilling finish
item.description: GB's David Weir misses out on a seventh London Marathon victory, finishing fifth in the 2013 wheelchair race, which was won by Australia's Kurt Fearnley.

item.title: VIDEO: London Marathon sights and sounds
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the highlights of the 2013 London Marathon where Kenya's Priscah Jeptoo triumphed in the women's race and Ethiopian Tsegaye Kebede was the fastest man.

item.title: VIDEO: Hull KR knock Saints out of Challenge Cup
item.description: Hull Kingston Rovers knock 12-man St Helens out of the Challenge Cup at the fourth round stage with a 26-18 victory at Craven Park.

item.title: VIDEO: Sunderland still not safe - Di Canio
item.description: Sunderland boss Paolo Di Canio says his side are not yet guaranteed Premier League survival, despite beating Everton 1-0 at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: VIDEO: Defeat difficult to explain - Martinez
item.description: Wigan boss Roberto Martinez says his side "should have got something" after their 2-0 defeat at West Ham, and admits he finds it "hard to understand" how his side lost.

item.title: VIDEO: Keatings delighted with golden return
item.description: Britain's Daniel Keatings "confident" after winning European gold in the pommel horse final in Russia.

item.title: How credible is Celtic's title triumph?
item.description: Former Celtic favourite Pat Bonner looks at what the club's SPL title win means in the absence of Rangers

item.title: Ronnie the Rolling Stone
item.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan makes his comeback at the World Championship and provides some much-needed box office

item.title: 'Absolutely nuts' Murray 'is a brilliant captain'
item.description: She may like steaks, cakes and laughs, but Judy Murray knows what she's talking about, says Jonathan Overend

item.title: A decade on: When Radcliffe had the world in awe
item.description: Paula Radcliffe talks to chief sports writer Tom Fordyce 10 years after smashing the marathon world record

item.title: Lewis Hamilton: Racing is more strategic now
item.description: In his latest BBC Sport column, Lewis Hamilton talks about strategic racing and his car collection, as well as answering your questions

item.title: From San Siro to a concentration camp
item.description: The story of Ferdinando Valletti, the Italian whose football skills helped him survive a concentration camp

item.title: Warner's football legacy goes on
item.description: Former Fifa vice president Jack Warner's football legacy goes on as he faces further accusations from Concacaf

item.title: End of season ups and downs
item.description: How will your team fare? Promotion, relegation and the race for Europe across England and Scotland

item.title: Must-not-miss sport on the BBC
item.description: Your guide to this weekend's sporting events on the BBC

item.title: London 2012's most-watched
item.description: BBC Sport reveals all 50 of the most-watched videos from the 2012 London Olympics

item.title: Record sales for Anniversary Games
item.description: Tickets for the first two days of the London 2012 Anniversary Games at the Olympic Stadium sell out in only 75 minutes.

item.title: Chisora labours to win over Avila
item.description: Dereck Chisora beats Hector Alfredo Avila in the ninth round in his first fight since losing to David Haye in July.

item.title: Wright inspires Warwickshire win
item.description: Chris Wright takes 6-31 as Warwickshire bowl out Durham to win their Championship game at Edgbaston by 318 runs.

item.title: GB's Reade & Phillips win again
item.description: Shanaze Reade and Liam Phillips give Britain a clean sweep of victories for the second night at the BMX World Cup in Manchester.

item.title: Boston marathon winner races London
item.description: Tatyana McFadden is one of 24 wheelchair athletes who will compete in London after taking part in Boston on the day of the bombings.

item.title: Liverpool v Chelsea
item.description: Preview followed by live coverage of Sunday's game between Liverpool and Chelsea in the Premier League.

item.title: Bahrain GP stupid - Ecclestone
item.description: Formula 1 boss Bernie Ecclestone believes the Bahrain government were "stupid in a lot of ways" for hosting a grand prix.

item.title: Donald one behind at RBC Heritage
item.description: Luke Donald remains in contention at the RBC Heritage with a second-round 68 to move within one shot of the lead.

item.title: Godsmejudge wins Scottish National
item.description: Godsmejudge, ridden by by Wayne Hutchinson, becomes the youngest horse since 2001 to win the Scottish Grand National.

item.title: Marquez storms to pole in Texas
item.description: Spain's Marc Marquez becomes the youngest rider to earn a MotoGP pole with a superb ride at the Grand Prix of the Americas.

item.title: GB's Whitlock wins European silver
item.description: Double Olympic bronze medallist Max Whitlock secures his first senior European medal with second place in the all-around in Russia

item.title: Keighley 4-74 Warrington
item.description: Holders Warrington Wolves ease through to round five of the Challenge Cup with a convincing win at Keighley Cougars.

item.title: London Wasps 24-37 Exeter Chiefs
item.description: Exeter Chiefs boosted their hopes of a Heineken Cup spot as they condemn London Wasps to a seventh consecutive defeat.

item.title: O'Sullivan eases through at Worlds
item.description: Four-time world champion Ronnie O'Sullivan beats Marcus Campbell 10-4 in their first round match at the Crucible.

item.title: Armstrong withdraws from swim meet
item.description: Disgraced cyclist Lance Armstrong withdraws from the US Masters swimming championships after an objection from Fina.

item.title: Robson draws GB level in Argentina
item.description: Laura Robson brings Great Britain level at 1-1 in their Fed Cup tie against Argentina with victory over Florencia Molinero.

item.title: Barrow sets British snowboard record
item.description: Bath-based Jamie Barrow sets the British speed snowboarding record after reaching 94 mph in Verbier, Switzerland.

item.title: Hull FC 62-6 Crusaders
item.description: Full-back Jamie Shaul's hat-trick helps Hull FC reach the Challenge Cup fifth round with victory against Crusaders.

item.title: Lennon targets squad improvements
item.description: Celtic boss Neil Lennon admits some players may leave in the summer, but replacements will depend on future income.

item.title: Platini doubts Wales' Euro 2020 bid
item.description: Uefa president Michel Platini says Cardiff lacks the required infrastructure to be a host city for Euro 2020.

item.title: McDowell four behind in Heritage
item.description: Graeme McDowell trails leader Charley Hoffman by four shots going into Sunday's final round of the Heritage event.
